title: Sketchbook Folio, "Minerva and a winged god", 1813–18
medium: Pen and brown ink, dark brown wash, over black chalk on white laid paper
inscribed: in pen and brown ink at lower left corner: 35; at right center: Rubens Parigi. On verso: Bramante Lodi
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Minerva standing at left with winged male figure; four putti with two captives at center; satyr head at far right, and six sketched figures in distance.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sketchbook Folio, "Minerva and a winged god", 1813–18.
1813–18. Pen and brown ink, dark brown wash, over black chalk on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3504.
